title: Togglefunction Tutorial
materials_required: Resistors (various values, including one for the LED)
description: This tutorial explains how to create a toggle function using an Arduino, a push button, and an LED. Pressing the button will toggle the LED on or off.
steps: Install the Arduino software from the provided link.
In the Arduino IDE, within the 'void setup()' function, configure pin 7 as an INPUT and pin 12 as an OUTPUT.
In the 'void loop()' function, read the input from pin 7 using 'digitalRead(7)' and store it in the 'input' variable. Define 'input' as an integer ('int input = 0;') outside of the loop.
Define a boolean variable 'pin0n' (e.g., 'boolean pin0n = false;') outside the loop. This will represent the state of the LED (true for on, false for off).

Create an 'if' statement that checks if 'input' is 1 (button pressed) AND 'pin0n' is false. If so, set 'pin0n' to true.  Add an 'else if' condition that checks if 'input' is 1 AND 'pin0n' is true. If so, set 'pin0n' to false.
Create another 'if' statement: If 'pin0n' is true, write HIGH to pin 12 (turn the LED on). Else, write LOW to pin 12 (turn the LED off).

On the breadboard, connect a wire from the Arduino's 5V port to one side of the push button.  Connect the other side of the push button to a resistor that leads to ground.  Also, connect a wire from the button's output side to Arduino's pin 7.
Connect a wire from Arduino's pin 12 (with a suitable resistor) to the positive side of the LED. Connect the negative side of the LED to ground.
Upload the code to the Arduino.
